title: Artificial Intelligence Ethics and International Law: An Introduction
author: Abhivardhan
summary: This book by Abhivardhan offers a foundational introduction to the ethical considerations and international legal frameworks surrounding artificial intelligence (AI). It explores the global landscape of AI governance, the intersection of technology with legal norms, and the challenges posed by autonomous systems and algorithms in international contexts. Aimed at scholars, practitioners, and policymakers, it serves as a primer on how law and ethics converge in the age of intelligent machines.
notes: Focuses on India’s approach and perspective in international AI regulation; emphasizes soft law and normative ethics.

title: Artificial Intelligence Meets Augmented Reality: Redefining Regular Reality
author: Chitra Lele
summary: This book explores the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) and augmented reality (AR), showcasing how their convergence is reshaping industries and redefining human-computer interaction. Chitra Lele outlines practical applications, innovative use cases, and the technological underpinnings of combining AI with AR to enhance real-world experiences across sectors like healthcare, education, and retail.
notes: Emphasizes hands-on and real-world case studies; focuses on Indian and global industry applications.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Reshaping Life and Business
author: Dr. Prabhat Kumar
summary: In this book, Dr. Prabhat Kumar explores the transformative role of artificial intelligence in modern life and business environments. The text covers AI fundamentals, societal impacts, business applications, and ethical considerations. It provides insights into how AI technologies are driving innovation in sectors such as healthcare, finance, manufacturing, and education, while also discussing future trends and challenges.
notes: Includes introductory-level content suitable for business leaders and students; focuses on applied aspects of AI in India and globally.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning for Decision Makers
author: Dr. Jagreet Kaur, Navdeep Singh Gill
summary: This book provides a strategic overview of artificial intelligence (AI) and deep learning technologies tailored for decision makers, business leaders, and executives. Authored by Dr. Jagreet Kaur and Navdeep Singh Gill, it demystifies complex AI concepts and connects them to real-world applications in business, government, and industry. The text bridges the gap between technical knowledge and strategic adoption, enabling leaders to make informed choices in a data-driven world.
notes: Written with a non-technical audience in mind; includes business frameworks and case studies to support executive-level understanding of AI deployment.

title: A Practical Approach for Machine Learning and Deep Learning Algorithms: Tools and Technique using MATLAB and Python
author: Abhishek Kumar Pandey, Pramod Singh Rathore, Dr. S. Balamurugan
summary: This book offers a hands-on approach to understanding and implementing machine learning and deep learning algorithms using MATLAB and Python. Geared toward students, engineers, and practitioners, the authors cover a range of core concepts including supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, deep neural nets, and various tool-based implementations. The book emphasizes practical execution and real-world applicability.
notes: Useful for learners transitioning from theory to implementation; focuses heavily on code examples and lab exercises in both MATLAB and Python.

title: AI and ML Powering the Agents of Automation: Demystifying IoT, Robots, ChatBots, RPA, Drones & Autonomous Cars – The New Workforce Led Digital Reinvention Facilitated by AI & ML and Secured through Blockchain
author: Deepika M, Vijay Cuddapah, Amitendra Srivastava, Srinivas Mahankali
summary: This book explores how Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are driving the next wave of digital automation. Covering a wide spectrum of intelligent agents—including IoT systems, chatbots, drones, RPA bots, and autonomous vehicles—it presents an integrated view of the digital workforce. The authors also touch on the role of blockchain in ensuring trust and security in AI-powered ecosystems, making this a comprehensive guide to the interconnected future of intelligent automation.
notes: Targets business leaders and tech enthusiasts; unifies emerging technologies under the AI/ML automation narrative. Blockchain is treated as a security and trust enabler.

title: Grokking Deep Learning
author: Andrew W. Trask
summary: Grokking Deep Learning is an accessible and engaging introduction to deep learning. Written by Andrew W. Trask, it guides readers through building their own neural networks from scratch using Python and NumPy, without relying on high-level libraries. The book uses a conversational tone and step-by-step examples to help beginners understand the math and intuition behind deep learning algorithms, including backpropagation, gradient descent, and more.
notes: Focuses on conceptual clarity and hands-on code. Ideal for readers with basic Python skills and minimal math background.

title: Machine Learning and Data Science: Fundamentals and Applications
author: Prateek Agrawal, Charu Gupta, Anand Sharma, Vishu Madaan, Nisheeth Joshi (Editors)
summary: This edited volume provides a comprehensive overview of foundational concepts and real-world applications in machine learning and data science. Covering a broad range of topics including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, data mining, and statistical modeling, the book brings together research insights and applied case studies across various domains. It is suited for researchers, data scientists, and advanced students seeking to understand both theory and practice.
notes: Includes multidisciplinary perspectives; features case studies and research-based contributions from a variety of authors in academia and industry.

title: Machine Learning Security Principles: Keep Data, Networks, Users, and Applications Safe from Prying Eyes
author: John Paul Mueller
summary: This book provides a practical guide to the security challenges and solutions associated with machine learning systems. John Paul Mueller explores how to safeguard data pipelines, defend models against adversarial attacks, and secure AI applications at all stages—from data ingestion to deployment. Readers learn about potential vulnerabilities, security best practices, and privacy concerns in ML workflows, making it ideal for developers, data scientists, and security professionals.
notes: Focuses on actionable techniques and real-world scenarios for enhancing ML security. Emphasizes model integrity, data protection, and secure deployment.
